alert.note: Alert for Eastern Sierra Slopes of Inyo County; Owens Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued April 06 at 12:16PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...Water levels rising on creeks and streams in Inyo County... Snowmelt in the southern Sierra Nevada of Inyo will start to accelerate with the onset of warmer temperatures. Creeks, streams and rivers will beginning experiencing higher flows that will likely continue for weeks. As creeks swell, some campgrounds will be at risk of flooding. Roads used to access campgrounds and hiking trailheads will also be at risk of flooding. Remember, never drive through flooded roadways or around barricades. Pastureland or farmland adjacent to creeks, streams and rivers could experience areas of flooding and a prolonged period of standing water. For further information on Inyo National Forecast Campgrounds go to: fs.usda.gov/Internet/FSE_DOCUMENTS/fseprd486882.pdf Due to their swift currents and very cold water temperatures, creeks and streams pose life-threatening dangers. Extra caution should be exercised as exhaustion or unconsciousness from hypothermia could set in quickly. Always wear a properly fitted life jacket for all water activities. For further information on cold water go to: https://www.weather.gov/safety/coldwater

area.areaDesc: Eastern Sierra Slopes of Inyo County; Owens Valley
